title: ICE: Broken MIR: generator contains type Vec<[u8; 16]> in MIR, but typeck only knows about X, Y, Z

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: AsyncAwait-Triaged
labels.description: Async-await issues that have been triaged during a working group meeting.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code code from glacier fixed/74906.rs ```Rust #![feature(const_generics)] #![allow(incomplete_features)] #![crate_type = "lib"] pub async fn baz() { biz(&Vec::new()).await; } const SIZE: usize = 16; pub async fn biz(_: &[[u8; SIZE]]) {} ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.56.0-nightly (3d0774d0d 2021-08-18) binary: rustc commit-hash: 3d0774d0dc98084d25d95cc1909a8051ebbd9cb1 commit-date: 2021-08-18 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.56.0-nightly LLVM version: 12.0.1 ``` ### Error output `rustc ./74906.rs -Zunstable-options --edition 2018` ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_mir/src/transform/generator.rs:750:13: Broken MIR: generator contains type Vec<[u8; 16]> in MIR, but typeck only knows about {ResumeTy, Vec<[u8; _]>, &[[u8; _]], &Vec<[u8; _]>, impl Future, ()} and [] --> ./74906.rs:5:36 | 5 | pub async fn baz() { | ____________________________________^ 6 | | biz(&Vec::new()).await; 7 | | } | |_^ thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box', /rustc/3d0774d0dc98084d25d95cc1909a8051ebbd9cb1/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1061:9 stack backtrace: ```
Backtrace

start_thread 60: 0x7f39162915e3 - __GI___clone 61: 0x0 - note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug. note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md note: rustc 1.56.0-nightly (3d0774d0d 2021-08-18) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu note: compiler flags: -Z unstable-options query stack during panic: #0 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `baz::{closure#0}` #1 [layout_raw] computing layout of `[static generator@./74906.rs:5:36: 7:2]` #2 [layout_raw] computing layout of `std::future::from_generator::GenFuture<[static generator@./74906.rs:5:36: 7:2]>` #3 [optimized_mir] optimizing MIR for `baz` end of query stack error: aborting due to previous error ```
